title: Modern Concrete Home in the U.K.’s Forest of Dean Asks £2.89 Million
text:
An award-winning contemporary home in the Forest of Dean, an ancient woodland in England near the Welsh border, is looking for a buyer.



Dubbed Outhouse, it hit the market last week with a £2.89 million (US$3.56 million) asking price.



More: Former Los Angeles Dodgers Owner Sells Palm Beach Mansion for Almost $100M

The artist owners of Outhouse bought the four-acre property in Gloucestershire in 2010, while looking for a site to build a contemporary home that would provide enough space to hold both their studios, according to listing brokerage The Modern House.



At the time, the lot was home to a Victorian cottage and a series of outbuildings but after four years of design and building work by Loyn and Co architects, a home was created that was described in Architects Journal magazine in 2016 as “one of the most outstanding new houses in Britain in a decade.”



It went on to win several architectural awards, including a Manser Medal, and was shortlisted for more, including the 2016 Royal Institute of British Architects (RIBA) House of the Year and a RIBA Stirling Prize.

While the 5,136-square-foot concrete structure evokes “a monolithic and unchanging quality,” the brokerage said in a statement, when viewed from behind it’s almost invisible, due to its flat green roof that blends into the landscape.



Outhouse is reached by a private driveway that leads into a paved carport complete with charging points for electric vehicles, skylights and a “dramatic external hall,” the listing said.



Inside are more skylights, floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the rural countryside, a modern kitchen with access to an external cold storage space, three bedrooms, and a multiple art studios with access to a courtyard garden



Also on the grounds is a summer house and a grazing meadow.



The owners of Outhouse could not be reached for comment and Mansion Global could not determine how much they paid for the property.
